comment: Easy class to pass as long as you attend the class and take notes, just write down exactly what she writes on the board. It's not hard to follow. If you have issues with your eyesight, sit closer to the board. She clearly has a passion for what she is teaching. If for whatever reason you have an issue with women's role in history, coverurears.

She does make this class simple, but god she is a tough grader. The people here who complain about  her talking about women most likely just dislike women for whatever reason. Reading responses were frustrating at times and the labs as well, but go to class and you'll be fine. You will need the lecture notes to have evidence for the exams.

Loved her, she made history interesting and talked about women and different cultures/religions. To get an A you definitely need to go to class or get the notes from someone else. There are like 2 reading responses a week and random labs but she provides extra credit. If you have questions about exams or the paper just ask her she's nice.

She is good but requires you to do short answer responses 2 times a week and due an hour before class so its hard to remember to do them. She drops 3 of those and her exams are all written but she gives you a note card to write information and gives you the prompts ahead of time you just don't know which one you'll get. Overall not a bad teacher!

I do not recommend. The class was extremely frustrating. There is a reading response every single night almost and sometimes the source for them is a 2 hour podcast. No notes posted online she scribbles on the board and her handwriting is hard to read. The tests are essays that she gives no guidance on. Random “labs” in class. Heed my warning.

Main issue I had was the first exam we took there was no written rubric given prior to the essay. After she stated that papers that got A's had a certain amount of names and sources used. Another issue, she requires you to use sources such as images from her PowerPoint yet she will not post them. She writes wherever she can fit on the board.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Definitely would recommend Professor Neary compared to other Hist professors at KSU. However, beware she is a tough grader on exams and there are only two throughout the semester. Overall, an enjoyable teacher for lectures. Don't forget to do reading responses, as they are pretty much due before every class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I hate classes like this but she made it fairly easy. I would take her again. Her lectures are not boring and if you pay attention you can learn a lot. There are reading responses due before class but it is just a simple paragraph and she grades it based on your opinion. She does make you present a project but it's not bad at all. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Neary is great, lectures every day where she writes notes on the board for you to copy down. Her curriculum is so interesting, and she makes sure to teach us equally, if not more about women and gay people. Reading Responses before most classes and Labs (reading) like once a week. Tests are essays. Take her you'll learn a lot!

Dr. Neary was very good, there is not too much homework, only 2 assignments before class every week, her lectures are fairly engaging, they can be stale at some points, but nothing too crazy. The tests are fairly easy, but she does grade the essay portion pretty hard. Overall, she is a very good professor, and I would recommend her

She is a great teacher and knows her stuff. However, she ties everything back to women, (picking apart everything they could and could not do in every single part of history). Nothing wrong with that, but seems unnecessary to bring it up every lecture and then talk about intercourse in every single society. I wish she taught about wars, not sex.
Very nice teacher, lectures are engaging, 2 short reading responses a week due before class, test are 'essay test'- she grades them pretty harshly. overall an easy class.

the negative reviews are so exaggerating and written by people who don't pay attention. she's a great professor! i'd highly recommend going to class to take notes everyday and also in case of a lab. i really don't like history but she made this class so simple. don't take her if you intend to skip every lecture though, because you won't do well
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: One of the worst professors I've ever had. Never responds to emails, (had to email her 3 times before she responded). Every day before class there is a reading response and the links for it are in different spots, the times are wrong too and random labs that aren't on the syllabus that she doesn't mention or warn you about before. do not recommend

Reading responses every day before class. Attendance is not mandatory but there are graded labs and you dont know when they are. Is the class itself easy? Yes. Professor Neary's online setup though is confusing and she is fast when it comes to writing and talking so be prepared to write quickly.
LOVEDDD Ms. Neary. Her lectures are great and easy to follow. She doesn't just read off a slide, it makes her class very interesting

I am not someone who is often entertained by history lectures, but Professor Neary made it very easy to want to go to class. She was very nice and her lectures were thorough and easy to grasp. Graded on lab days, 2 essay-style exams (gives prompts before), and a big project. Super easy A if you listen and take notes. Would take her again!

She literally makes everything so easy to understand, best Professor. It's hard to fail her class if you show up and do the work. Her class is not heavy work either. She's very understanding of the students, and very chill.
Overall a great class! She gives a lot of extra credit and opportunities to pass.
